snippet: LEAD: The western edge of the continent has never been an ideal place for a highway, what with the pounding surf eroding the shore from below and the cliffs washing down from above. Repair crews of the state Department of Transportation face a Sis...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: The western edge of the continent has never been an ideal place for a highway, what with the pounding surf eroding the shore from below and the cliffs washing down from above. Repair crews of the state Department of Transportation face a Sisyphean labor keeping California Route 1 open under the best of circumstances.

headline.main: Stinson Beach Journal;   The Road That Persists In Falling Into the Sea

byline.original: By JANE GROSS, Special to The New York Times
